ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: bank system. inflation. macromanagement by FED

I gained a lot of solid knowledge on macroeconomics which I found practical and inspiring. This includes accounting of GDP, mechanism of banking system, Solow Model, inflation, AD/AS model, etc. Furthermore, the course enhanced my understanding of the nature of economics as an academic discipline(particularly macroeconomics, but economics or even social sciences in general). The course is an introductory course but it goes way beyond high-school-level economics and is a very fruitful course that I would recommend to anyone who is interested in economics, regardless of whether they've taken economics at high school or not.
I was able to learn a lot of macroeconomics such as how to graph the different types of graph to learning more conceptual topics which weren't covered in microeconomics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strength: motivating students discussing public problrm. high participation

Strength: The recorded lectures are really engaging and inspiring! I loved every single lecture. Weakness: Therefore, I wish we could actually have those lectures on-campus, rather than watching the recordings.

Strengths: The material is covered in sufficient depth and the professor engages the class extremely well. The psets being marked on check is especially useful in facilitating learning as the solutions provided afterwards help you grasp everything clearly without stressing you out about being correct. Weaknesses: There is too much pre-reading for each class that is problematic because the class is taught in a very active fashion, relying heavily on question and answers. If this load can be reduced, its easier to prepare for class rather than being too overwhelmed and lost.
Potentially holding classes three times per week to spread content out more evenly.

I think the weakness was that I had to get up at 7:00am because of the time difference so it was difficult to focus sometimes because of how early my class was. I think making the class start at 8:00am or maybe at 9:00 pst because that gives people on the west coast a little more time to sleep. Strengths were that he was very clear at explaining the topics and based on the review sessions, even from just regular class you had a sense of what you were going to be tested on in the exam. I recommend this class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Professional teaching with professor's heuristic own opion help students learn how the economics work better

Yes, as I mentioned in Q1, I would recommend this course to anyone who is interested in economics. First of all, this course teaches a variety of basic (but useful) economic models and covers a range of relevant topics, so you will really learn some economic knowledge. Secondly, (perhaps more importantly), I think this course demonstrates the charm of economics in general. For every model we saw in class, there was a solid deduction process that shows how these models are constructed and how are they supported by real-life data. Going through such process almost feels like being an economist and I personally enjoyed it.

Yes, I would. This class is well organized and there are many resources that can help supplement your learning. I did not feel overwhelmed at any point and the material is presented in an engaging way. I thought that the professor explained the concepts we needed to know very clearly in discussion sections and I didn't ever feel lost during the course.
Yes, highly recommend taking this course with Prof Arnold. He is very engaged and a fantastic teacher.
I would recommend this course to another student because I really enjoyed it.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments:
understand how the meaning of FED raising interest rate
change investmentment portfolio according to expected inflation

After taking this course, I feel motivated to take further advanced economics course. The knowledge and skills I learned in this course will certainly help me to go over the more advanced courses. Besides, I am confident that I've improved my capability of analyzing current macroeconomic affairs, and that I will use what I learned to explain the news and economic trends I see in daily life.
I hope to use it in intermediate macroeconomics.
